rgraph

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • rgraph.Robot

  • public class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
    Robot represents a connect set of units.

    A robot has two representations to speed up algorithmic running time. It has both a graphical and a spatial representation. The natural representation is a graphical relation between logical modules in the graph. From this representation we can create a spatial representation, an k-d representation of the robot which reflect actual module locations in space.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Robot

        public Robot(boolean[][] moduleBools,
             boolean expanded)
        Constructs a robot from a 2d array of modules.
        Parameters:
        moduleBools - 2d boolean array specifying locations of modules.
        expanded - false implies 2x2 modules taking up 2x2 space, true implies 2x2 modules taking up 3x3 space.

      • Robot

        public Robot(ModuleGraph moduleGraph,
             boolean expanded)
        Constructs a robot from a module graph.

        This allows construction of a new robot from a subset of another robot, i.e. allowing for splits or combinations of robots.

        Parameters:
        moduleGraph - graph representing the modules of the robot to construct
        expanded - true value initializes an expanded robot

      • Robot

        public Robot(ModuleGraph moduleGraph)
        Constructs a robot from a module graph.

        This allows construction of a new robot from a subset of another robot, i.e. allowing for splits or combinations of robots.

        Parameters:
        moduleGraph - graph representing the modules of the robot to construct

      • expandAll

        public void expandAll()
        Expands all arms in the robot. Note that this only works if all edges are already contracted

      • contractAll

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Robot other)
        Tests Robot Equality.

        Two robots are equal if:

        • All modules in moduleArray are in same location
        Parameters:
        other - Robot to test against
        Returns:
        true if robots "look" the same, i.e. robots have modules in the same locations.
